Class ScalarLinearFilter

java.lang.Object
  Filter
      ScalarFilter
          ScalarLinearFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
FIRFilter
public class ScalarLinearFilter
extends ScalarFilter

This class is the ScalarLinearFilter and is a subclass of the #ScalarFilter. This filter follows filtering and resetting formulas that can be found in the Hw11(2).pdf file.

Author:
StevePaley

ScalarLinearFilter

public ScalarLinearFilter(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> inCoefficients,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Number> outCoefficients)
Create a new instance of the ScalarLinearFilter with the coefficient parameters that will be used in the calculations.

Parameters:
inCoefficients - The coefficients used in the input dot product calculation
outCoefficients - The coefficients used in the output dot product calculation
Method Detail

filter

public Signal<java.lang.Number> filter(Signal<java.lang.Number> input)
Filter the input #Signal and generate the output is generated via the equation found in Hw11(2).pdf. This equation takes the dot product of the coefficients and the list of previous inputs/outputs and then subtracts the output dot product from the input dot product.

Overrides:
filter in class ScalarFilter
Parameters:
input - The #Signal to be filtered.
Returns:
The #Signal that is the result of the filter calculations.

reset

public void reset(Signal<java.lang.Number> resetValue)
Reset the filter using the equation found in Hw11(2).pdf. The equation is to sum the coefficient lists and the input coefficient sum are multiplied by the reset value and divided by one plus the output coefficient sum. The previous input list is set to the reset value and the previous output list is set to the calculated reset value.

Overrides:
reset in class ScalarFilter
Parameters:
resetValue - The number that will be used in the reset calculation.

numberToFill - The input to the list
